summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons (BOP) policy document from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, titled 'Patient care, Sick Call, Urgent care for Medical, Dental, and Psychiatric Services.' It outlines detailed procedures for inmate healthcare, including intake screening, sick call, emergency response, dental services, copayment fees, and management of special housing units. It is a standard operating procedure and does not mention any specific individuals or events related to the Epstein case.
locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center New York, New York
keyFacts: This is a general BOP healthcare policy document (Institution Supplement NYM - 6031.03C) dated May 29, 2013, for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
The document details procedures for inmate medical, dental, and psychiatric care, including intake screening, sick call, emergency response, and copayment fees.
It specifies that emergency medical care for life-threatening conditions is provided at New York Down Town Hospital, while urgent non-life-threatening care is at Brooklyn Hospital.
The document is a standard operating procedure and contains no references to Jeffrey Epstein, his associates, victims, or any specific events related to his case.
The file name (EFTA00140803.pdf) and dataset number are part of the Epstein document release, but the content of this specific file is unrelated to the case's core events or figures.
